content.question: Which of the following statements regarding accounting profits, opportunity costs, and economic profits is true?

choices.label: With positive opportunity costs, a firm can never earn economic profits.
Accounting profits are equal to economic profits minus opportunity costs.
If accounting profits are less than opportunity costs, there will be economic losses.
Economic profits must always be greater than accounting profits.
When economic profits are positive, accounting profits may be positive or negative.

content.answer: If accounting profits are less than opportunity costs, there will be economic losses.
